Class TagTreeNode

java.lang.Object

java.lang.Comparable
public class TagTreeNode
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable

This class represents a node in the binary tree representing the tag lexicon.

1.0

Gerald Veldhuijsen

Method Detail

compareTo

public int compareTo(java.lang.Object o1)
              throws java.lang.ClassCastException
Compares the tag code of a given tree node with the tag code of itself. This method is part of the implementation of the Comparable interface.

Specified by:
compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable
Parameters:
o1 - Object the tree node to compare to.
Returns:
-1, zero, or 1 if the tag code of this tree node is less, equal to, or greater than the tag code of the given tree node.
Throws:
java.lang.ClassCastException - if the given argument is not an instance of the class TreeNode.

equals

public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
               throws java.lang.ClassCastException
Compares the tag code of the given tree node with the tag code of this node.

Parameters:
o - Object the tree node to compare to.
Returns:
true if the given tree node has the same tag code as the current one, otherwise it returns false.
Throws:
java.lang.ClassCastException - if the object o is not an instance of the class TreeNode.
